name: Diplo
description:
'''Thomas Wesley Pentz''' (born November 10, 1978), known professionally as '''Diplo''', is an American DJ and music producer. He is a co-creator and lead member of the electronic [[dancehall]] music project [[Major Lazer]]; a member of the supergroup [[LSD (group)|LSD]], with [[Labrinth]] and [[Sia]]; a member of electronic duo [[Jack Ü]], with producer and DJ [[Skrillex]]; and a member of [[Silk City (band)|Silk City]], with [[Mark Ronson]]. He founded the record company [[Mad Decent]] in 2006 and the nonprofit organization Heaps Decent in 2007. His 2013 extended play (EP) ''Revolution'' debuted at number 68 on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. Its title track was later featured in a [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]] commercial and appears on the ''[[WWE 2K16]]'' soundtrack.

Diplo worked with and dated British musician [[M.I.A. (rapper)|M.I.A.]], producing her 2008 breakout single "[[Paper Planes (M.I.A. song)|Paper Planes]]", which gave him initial mainstream exposure. In 2011, he and fellow producer [[Switch (house DJ)|Switch]] formed the electronic musical group Major Lazer and its [[Major Lazer (TV series)|namesake cartoon series]] for [[FXX]], which ran for one season. The group released five studio albums that explored EDM and dancehall music, pioneering a new musical genre, ReggaeEDM. Since then, Diplo has produced for and collaborated with many mainstream musical acts, including [[Blackpink]], [[Jennie (singer)|Jennie]], [[Lil Peep]], [[Gwen Stefani]], [[Die Antwoord]], [[Britney Spears]], [[Madonna]], [[Shakira]], [[Beyoncé]], [[Ellie Goulding]], [[the Weeknd]], [[No Doubt]], [[Justin Bieber]], [[Usher (musician)|Usher]], [[Anitta (singer)|Anitta]], [[Snoop Dogg]], [[Trippie Redd]], [[Chris Brown]], [[CL (rapper)|CL]], [[G-Dragon]], [[Bad Bunny]], [[Kali Uchis]], [[Joji (musician)|Joji]], [[Morgan Wallen]], [[Bailey Zimmerman]], [[MØ]], and [[Poppy (singer)|Poppy]]. His alias, short for ''[[Diplodocus]]'', derives from his childhood fascination with dinosaurs.
